questions.question: Testing AI-generated code is:
questions.explanation: Testing AI-generated code is essential because AI can make mistakes and miss edge cases.

questions.question: Unit tests focus on:
questions.explanation: Unit tests focus on testing individual components or functions in isolation.

questions.question: Test-driven development means:
questions.explanation: Test-driven development (TDD) means writing tests before writing the code that makes them pass.

questions.question: Good test coverage target is:
questions.explanation: Aim for 70%+ overall coverage, with 90%+ for critical paths.

questions.question: Tests should focus on:
questions.explanation: Tests should focus on user-facing behavior, not implementation details.

questions.question: Continuous testing helps:
questions.explanation: Continuous testing helps catch issues early and prevent broken code from being merged.

questions.question: Why is it important to test AI-generated code?
questions.sampleAnswer: AI can make mistakes, might miss edge cases, may have integration issues, and testing provides confidence that code works correctly before deployment.

questions.question: What's the difference between unit, integration, and E2E tests?
questions.sampleAnswer: Unit tests: individual components/functions, fast and isolated. Integration tests: how components work together, medium speed. E2E tests: complete user workflows, slower, full system.

questions.question: How do you debug a failing test?
questions.sampleAnswer: Read the error message, understand what failed, check test expectations, verify the code behavior, fix the code or test as needed, then re-run tests.

questions.question: Explain the benefits of test-driven development with AI.
questions.sampleAnswer: TDD with AI provides: clear requirements upfront, better test coverage, more focused code generation, and ensures code meets test specifications from the start.
